io.codecastle.scriptorium

Interface Inscribable<I,THIS extends Inscribable<I,THIS>>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - the inscribed type
    THIS - this type

    public interface Inscribable<I,THIS extends Inscribable<I,THIS>>
    Provides support for polyglot inscription services and inversion of flow control.

    Implementers may choose to pass another type <I> to consumers, e.g. a broader type that does not have methods consumers should not call (like close() or then()). This is referred to as the inscribed type.

    • Method Detail

      • inscribe

        <T extends FluentNode<THIS>> T inscribe(IOFunction<? super THIS,T> function)
                                 throws IOException
        Inscribes another FluentNode in this object, and returns it.

        This method calls the provided function, passing this object as the input, and returns the output.

        When the FluentNode.then() method of the returned node is called, this object will be returned.

        When this object or a parent object is closed, the FluentNode returned by this method will also be closed if it has not already been.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the inscription type
        Parameters:
        function - a function that returns a FluentNode whose parent is the function's argument
        Returns:
        the output of the provided function when called with this object as an argument
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • with

        THIS with(IOConsumer<? super I> consumer)
   throws IOException
        Calls the provided IOConsumer, passing an instance of the inscribed type, and returns this object.

        When this method returns, the provided consumer's IOConsumer.accept(Object) method will have already returned.

        Parameters:
        consumer - the IOConsumer to call with an instance of the inscribed type
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        withIf(boolean, IOConsumer)

      • with

        <T> THIS with(T element,
              IOBiConsumer<? super T,? super I> biConsumer)
       throws IOException
        Calls the provided IOBiConsumer, passing the provided element and an instance of the inscribed type, and returns this object.

        When this method returns, the provided bi-consumer's IOBiConsumer.accept(Object, Object) method will have already returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the element
        Parameters:
        element - the element to pass as the first argument of the provided bi-consumer
        biConsumer - the IOBiConsumer to call with an instance of the inscribed type
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        withIfNotNull(Object, IOBiConsumer), withIfPresent(Optional, IOBiConsumer), withEach(Object[], IOBiConsumer), withEach(Iterable, IOBiConsumer)

      • withIf

        default THIS withIf(boolean condition,
                    IOConsumer<? super I> consumer)
             throws IOException
        If the provided condition is true, calls the provided IOConsumer, passing an instance of the inscribed type; then returns this object.

        When this method returns, the provided consumer's IOConsumer.accept(Object) method will have already returned if the condition is true.

        The default implementation delegates to with(IOConsumer) when the provided condition is true.

        Parameters:
        condition - if this argument is true, the provided consumer will be called, otherwise this method has no effect
        consumer - the IOConsumer to call with an instance of the inscribed type
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        withIfNotNull(Object, IOBiConsumer), withIfPresent(Optional, IOBiConsumer)

      • withIfNotNull

        default <T> THIS withIfNotNull(T element,
                               IOBiConsumer<? super T,? super I> biConsumer)
                        throws IOException
        If the provided element is not null, calls the provided IOBiConsumer, passing the provided element and an instance of the inscribed type; then returns this object.

        When this method returns, the provided consumer's IOBiConsumer.accept(Object, Object) method will have already returned if the provided element is not null.

        The default implementation delegates to with(Object, IOBiConsumer) when the provided element is not null.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the element
        Parameters:
        element - the element to pass as the first argument of the provided bi-consumer; if this argument is null, this method has no effect
        biConsumer - the IOBiConsumer to call with an instance of the inscribed type
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        with(Object, IOBiConsumer), withIfPresent(Optional, IOBiConsumer), withIf(boolean, IOConsumer)

      • withIfPresent

        default <T> THIS withIfPresent(Optional<? extends T> optionalElement,
                               IOBiConsumer<? super T,? super I> biConsumer)
                        throws IOException
        If the provided optional element is present, calls the provided IOBiConsumer, passing the provided element and an instance of the inscribed type; then returns this object.

        When this method returns, the provided consumer's IOBiConsumer.accept(Object, Object) method will have already returned if the provided optional element is present.

        The default implementation delegates to with(Object, IOBiConsumer) when the provided optional element is present.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the element
        Parameters:
        optionalElement - the Optional whose contents will be pass as the first argument of the provided bi-consumer; if this objects Optional.isPresent() method returns false, this method has no effect
        biConsumer - the IOBiConsumer to call with an instance of the inscribed type
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        NullPointerException - if optionalElement is null
        See Also:
        with(Object, IOBiConsumer), withIfNotNull(Object, IOBiConsumer), withIf(boolean, IOConsumer)

      • withEach

        default <T> THIS withEach(T[] elements,
                          IOBiConsumer<? super T,? super I> biConsumer)
                   throws IOException
        Calls the provided IOBiConsumer multiple times, passing one of the provided elements and an instance of the inscribed type; then returns this object.

        When this method returns, the provided bi-consumer's IOBiConsumer.accept(Object, Object) method will have already returned once for each element in elements.

        The default implementation iterates over the provided elements, delegating to with(Object, IOBiConsumer) on each iteration.

        If the provided array is empty or null, this method has no effect.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements to pass as the first argument of the provided bi-consumer
        biConsumer - the IOBiConsumer to call with an instance of the inscribed type
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        withEach(Iterable, IOBiConsumer)

      • withEach

        default <T> THIS withEach(Iterable<? extends T> elements,
                          IOBiConsumer<? super T,? super I> biConsumer)
                   throws IOException
        Calls the provided IOBiConsumer multiple times, passing one of the provided elements and an instance of the inscribed type; then returns this object.

        When this method returns, the provided bi-consumer's IOBiConsumer.accept(Object, Object) method will have already returned once for each element in elements.

        The default implementation iterates over the provided elements, delegating to with(Object, IOBiConsumer) on each iteration.

        If the provided iterable is empty or null, this method has no effect.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements to pass as the first argument of the provided bi-consumer
        biConsumer - the IOBiConsumer to call with an instance of the inscribed type
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        withEach(Object[], IOBiConsumer)
